statement.tex: \text{A balloon, which always remains spherical,}\\ \text{has a variable diameter }\\ \qquad D = \frac{3}{2}\cdot(2x+1).\\ \text{ Find the rate of change of its volume}\\ \text{with respect to } x.

step.context: \textbf{Right or wrong? }\text{ - The question is }\\ \text{asking us to find the following.}
step.reason: \text{We have to find the rate of change }\\ \text{of volume with respect to x }\implies\frac{dV}{dx}. \\ \text{And we have not been told what x is. But}\\ \text{it could be anything - time, temperature, }\\ \text{pressure etc.}

step.context: \textbf{Right or wrong? }\text{- The following is the}\\ \text{volume in terms of the diameter (D).}
step.reason: \text{The volume of a sphere is }V=\frac{4}{3}\pi R^3. \\ \text{And } R=\frac{D}{2}\implies V = \frac{\pi\cdot D^3}{6}.
\text{Check the calculations if you got this wrong.}
